fields.description: I installed source tree on my windows 8 machine and choose to use embedded version of git and mercurial. When I try to clone a repository it says "Checking Source" then "This is not a valid source path /URL. I click details and a blank pop up appears. Not quite sure where to go from here.
fields.summary: Can Not Clone Repository Using SSH

fields.description:
When trying to checkout the code of Confluence on Windows 8, I noticed that some files are marked as "deleted". It turns out that the path lenght is over the 256 character limit.

I tryed the approach mentionned here :

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4992577/msys-git-and-long-paths

but it does not work ( use of '\\?\' in the Destination path while cloning )
fields.summary: Add Support for long paths under Windows
Trying to commit multiple files to a mapped network drive (where the code and repository is) and source tree CRASHES

fields.description:
I have a situation where I have 150+ conflicted files. Within SourceTree I select five files at a time and right click the selection choosing "Resolve Conflicts -> Launch External Merge Tool". I proceed to be prompted five times to resolve the merge conflicts and after the final conflict is resolved and I close KDiff3 the Staged Changes windows never refreshes and shows no items. The refresh "spinner" remains. At this point I need to restart SourceTree to continue conflict resolution.

My external merge tool is KDiff3.
I am using system git version 1.8.1.msysgit.1
fields.summary: Selecting multiple conflicted files and choosing "Resolve Conflicts -> Launch External Merge Tool" causes the conflict list to not refresh after the final file is reconciled

fields.description: http://blogs.atlassian.com/2013/05/alternatives-to-git-submodule-git-subtree/
fields.summary: Support git subtree

fields.description:
When trying to perform a search on any repository, if you select "File Changes" as the search criteria, the results do not come back as what you expect.

What I expect:
When searching with "File Changes" selected, the search will show all commits where a particularly named file (possibly with wildcards) appears.

What happens:
A random subset of commits is returned, sometimes the commits returned don't even contain the search string at all (ie they are randomly returned).

Furthermore, searching sometimes doesn't happen unless you hit the return key several times to "trigger" it to occur. The loading circle will show, but apparently nothing is happening in the background (ie you have to hit enter again to trigger a search).
fields.summary: Searching by "file changes" doesn't find all commits

fields.description:
Hi,

i would like to be able to configure SourceTree with an application link or some such to Jira so that Jira issue id's in commit message are turned into hyperlinks through to the issue.

An enhancement to this would be to do it like TeamCity does it where it actually brings through a few details of the issue into a hover pop up like Type, Status, Priority
fields.summary: Hyperlink jira issue id's in commit message to quickly take you to that issue

fields.description:
I did some experiments with a feature. I was dubious about the result and wanted to shelve them for later but in a branch to keep them. I wanted to push them in a feature branch.
 
As described in SRCTREEWIN-838 I had to reset hg flow but as there were changes in the repository which were not commited, Sourcetree or Hg generated a mq patch.
Unfortunately from this point I couldn't commit anything as there is no way to commit from a mq patch, which is normal, but there is no way to transform the patch as a commit either, not from sourcetree.

I used command line to do it in the end.

Also, note that it was not totally clear what was a patch and what was a commit. Also, the patches are not visible like the shelve patches in the repository view. That's super weird.

Before fixing the issue I tried to see the repo in TortoiseHG WorkBench which showe the patch in a list of patches applied. For some strange reason (unrelated to Sourcetree) I couldn't manage to commit the patch, which is why I did it in command line in the end.
fields.summary: SourceTree or Hg created MQ Patches automatically - no way to manipulate them!

fields.description:
Few versions before, I use the Hg Flow button on my repository and it created the whole thing.
After that there are two major changes I did that is related:

 1. I changed the name of the default branch to default instead of master, so I changed it in the .flow file as SourceTree don't have an interface for this.
 2. Because of another bug I had to switch to the embedded hg version.

Today I wanted to create a feature. The HG flow button doe spresent me the options which suggests that Hg Flow is already initialized. I try starting a feature but it fails because hg flow is not iniaitlized...

To fix the problem, I tried removing the .flow file. It worked but it re-initialized hg flow (fortunately Id didn't have any feature branch running anyway). Also, it created a .hgflow file instead of a .flow file.

Note that before doing this I first tried the command line but apparently there is no hg flow on my system, so even when I was using the system hg it was sourcetree that was really using it's own tools to do it.

My guess:

 a) I messed up with my change 1).
 b) the two hg versions don't use the same file name to configure hg flow OR sourctree used it's own flow file name when I was using the system hg and it don't match with the flow file name used by the mbedded hg version.
fields.summary: Hg Flow not initialized (but I already did initialize it before...)

fields.description:
When Sourcetree updates, the "pinned shortcut" on my task bar gets invalidated (turns into a white square). 
The workaround is to unpin it, open Sourcetree from the start menu, and then pin it to the task bar again.
fields.summary: Shortcut gets deleted when application updates

fields.description:
1) Open repo with subrepos
2) See that one of the subrepos has updates to be pulled
3) Open the subrepo and pull the updates.
4) Observe that the indicator in the main repo has not disappeared.
5) Close the main repo and open it again.
6) Observe that the indicator still has not disappeared.
fields.summary: Pull/push indicator for subrepo doesn't update when subrepo is updated

fields.description:
When attempting to remove a branch from the remote server which also has a tag with the same name, for example "feature/AutoPublish" as the tag and the branch name, this causes an error because there are 2 with the same name matching in git causing the command to fail.

The screenshot shows the output from sourcetree related to this, the command does not seem very specific to the fact that it is deleting a branch, is this potentially the cause of the problem?

Thanks
James
fields.summary: Trying to delete remote branch which has the same name as a tag causes error

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to have a checkbox or button which can be used to do a commit which holds the window open, as in the event of having multiple files to commit having to wait while the window closes and sourcetree then delays while it works out a refresh and then open the commit window it is quite a slowdown in workflow for this due to nature of small commits in git.
fields.summary: Keep commit window open

fields.description:
If I start SourceTree before unlocking my putty key it repeatedly demands a password. Pressing cancel, close, alt f4 and even unlocking my key and hitting enter fails to make it go away: It just instantly shows the dialogue again.
If I close ST it continues to pop up for about 4 iterations and then crashes.
fields.summary: "Authenticate" dialogue doesn't take no for an answer

fields.description: Please allow a Windows user to customize starting a command line shell. I recommend allowing the Windows user to specify a shortcut that gets invoked to run the shell.
fields.summary: enable users to easily customize the effect of the terminal button on Windows

fields.description:
I'm experiencing the following issue on Windows, but not OSX.

We have a server repository set up that we connect to over ssh using public/private key authentication. There is no need to use login credentials at all.

ON Windows, SourceTree is constantly prompting me for login credentials at unusual times. I can push and fetch without being asked for credentials, but if the app is sitting idle, I'll be polled for login credentials every so often.

In addition, I once gave it credentials to shut it up, and I ended up getting banned by the firewall because sourcetree was attempting to log into the server and was passing my password as the login name.

version = 1.0.6. Windows 8-64 bit enterprise.
fields.summary: Prompted for server credentials on Windows

fields.description:
Hello I'd love to see to be able to contribute to Sourcetree. It would be great to have a plugin system so I can easily integrate my feature. 

Currently we have developed to custom tool to handle your specific git needs, but I would be much more convenient to have it in Sourcetree. 

I think also payment could be an option for such a feature i.e. pay for Sourcetree with plugin system and keep normal Sourcetree without plugins.  Just my thoughts, but I see git coming here in Germany in the Automotive industry. As Sourcetree is better than tortoisegit it could be a chance. 
I'm keen on your feedback.
fields.summary: Create Eco System for Sourcetree like for e.g. Jira

fields.description:
Hello 

I did two updates from 1.0.4 to 1.0.5 to 1.0.6. each time I had to add all my repositories again to Sourcetree. 

Could not find any hint to perform an update any differently.
fields.summary: On update I loose all my added Repositories

fields.description:
i am working with SourceTree with the Git Flow model.

out of the develop branch i pulled two feature branches (feature3 and feature39)

both features are not yet complete so they have not been merged back to dev.

I worked on feature 3 and after getting to a some point, I moved to feature 39 and worked on it for a while

to be able to continue with feature3 i need some specific file changes made in feature39 (not a whole commit) and preferably only parts of files.

searching over the web i found this http://jasonrudolph.com/blog/2009/02/25/git-tip-how-to-merge-specific-files-from-another-branch/
which discusses how to pull only specific files from a branch to another branch

please add this feature to source tree.
also, please add an option to run the whole thing manually thus allowing me to control which hunks go from one branch to the other
fields.summary: Support pulling parts from a commit on one branch to another branch

fields.description:
Perhaps related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1292 but there are other conditions which cause this error. Search Mac source for 'SRCTREE-1292' to get the diff.

Reported via AAC here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/190694/my-sourcetree-don-t-want-to-show-the-log-it-says-git-log-failed-with-code-128-with-no-messages
fields.summary: Git log error code 128

fields.description: Sourcetree crashes on launch (Windows 7 64-bit) due to System.DllNotFoundException for "UIAutomationCore.dll" . Logfile is attached
fields.summary: Crashes on launch - UIAutomationCore.dll not found

fields.description:
Usually, if I pull any updates to a repo, the process to reload the everything just gets stuck and it shows "Loading" indefinitely. I have to close out SourceTree and then reload it in order to get it to refresh.

The repos I am working with have subrepos, but I am not sure if that affects anything.
fields.summary: Repositories constantly stuck "loading" after pull

fields.description:
When starting SourceTree, it just hangs "waiting" - even after a long time waiting.
It's certainly better that you show the UI immediately - with the "waiting/busy" - but it should show eventually.
fields.summary: Query of changes - too long or inaccurate

fields.description:
Since TortoiseHG is obsolete now that SourceTree is here for Windows, I decided to uninstall TortoiseHG. This also removed my terminal access for hg, since it was using the TortoiseHG version of Mercurial.

When using the embedded version of Mercurial, it would be nice, if the terminal also supported this version of the hg command. Should be relatively easy to set the PATH to the embedded Mercurial directory when clicking the terminal button:
C:\Users\[USERNAME]\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\hg_local
fields.summary: Using the embedded version of HG, hg does not work in the terminal

fields.description:
I would like to move or rename an existing file, but cannot do this from within SourceTree.

The file is an existing file and already part of the git repository. I can see it when selecting the "Show Clean" or "Show All" and it shows up in the File Status list (see attached image: sourcetree-screen-1.png).

Right clicking on the file gives me a context menu without the possibility to rename/move the file (see attached image: sourcetree-screen-3.png).

But when I look in the "Actions" menu can I see the "Move..." action, but greyed out (see attached image: sourcetree-screen-2.png).
fields.summary: File rename / move not supported?

fields.description:
In the log view, occasionally when clicking around, the file list will show the loading circle indefinitely, even with only 4 or 5 changes. Clicking on another changeset, working copy or switiching the view has no effect. No other git commands can be run. 

Restarting the program returns functionality to normal.

This occurs especially after returning from hibernate or otherwise a period of inactivity (an hour or two). Additionally, it's intermittent.
fields.summary: Filename lists don't always populate

fields.description: It reminded me that I needed to register to continue using source tree. When I tried to, Pakistan wasn't listed in the countries dropdown.
fields.summary: Pakistan is not listed in the signup form

fields.description:
Hello,

SourceTree is a great GUI for Git. My feature request affects the commit dialogue. It would be great if there would be the posibility to apply a bugtracker RSS Feed (for example Redmine, Bugzilla, Team Foundation Server) to a working copy. If we then commit ther schould be a box where we can choose the issue from the RSS Feed and this Issue Number would be added to the commit message.

We would like this feature because we develop software for our customers and we have to use the existing issue tracker system from the customers.

Thanks for the great work on SourceTree
fields.summary: Connect to BugTracker RSS Feeds

fields.description:
Ever since the last update, all my bookmarked repositories take excessively long to update their status.

!http://i.imgur.com/fjaISo9.png!

At first I thought this is a permanent state, but after several minutes the status for all repositories will update.

However, the *Staged Changes* pane will show the loading indicator forever and the whole view will never full load:

!http://i.imgur.com/3cpTxAe.png!
fields.summary: Loading of items takes long/forever

fields.description: After staying untouched for more then an hour, SourceTree view pulls from bitbucket repo, but not locally changed files. Refresh doesn't work; when trying to update it says about pending commits; but when it tries to commit, it crashes. After restart, everything is fine.
fields.summary: Crash when trying to commit

fields.description:
I have a case where I'm using HG Flow and I have default and develop branch. As I work a lot in the develop branch I didn't merge the default for a long time. 

In default, there is a subrepo which origin is in my own server (it's a private repo) and it requires login/password to access to. As usual if I clone that repository alone, or the parent repo, SourceTree will ask for the password.

However, if removed that subrepo in the develop branch. Now, I want to merge the develop branch into the default branch.
So I first update to the default branch.
But on update there is an error saying that there is a subrepo that needs login/password. and that the operation was done with failure.
Unfortunately I'm not exactly sure 

What I expected was the usual login/password window to spawn.

(To continue my work I used TortoiseHG to do the operation, it just asked the subrepos passwords; I guess it's just a prompt call missing in SourceTree)
fields.summary: Can't update to a branch where a subrepo asks for a password.

fields.description:
While the app was closed I removed a repo from my harddrive which I had previously bookmarked. After that when I opened SourceTree I got an app crash. The log file told me exactly what the problem was: 

Fatal error: 
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Error reading the D:\_DEV\current directory.

So I navigated to the AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\bookmarks.xml  and removed the TreeViewNode for that directory and everything worked fine after that.

I'm attaching the log file and the original and edited bookmarks.xml in case any of this is unclear.
fields.summary: Crash on startup when bookmarked folder not found

fields.description:
Since switching from SmartGitHg, and pointing SourceTree at the original clone, it's unable to perform a push operation. It's soft locking with the following in the full output:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin master:master neilogd_development:neilogd_development
Pushing to git@github.com:neilogd/Psybrus2.git

Attempted to clone fresh, working fine with https. Possible setup issue.
fields.summary: Unable to push, soft lock whilst pushing.

fields.description:
Can you please add auto updates to SourceTree? Like chrome or even GitHub for windows, please just handle the details. As much as I like features, I hate having to click through the details everytime. 
Thanks
fields.summary: Auto update

fields.description:
After commiting one or more files that have changed, the commit succeeds and then ST stalls in refreshing the directory state (on an admittedly large repo with a single hg subrepo). I can leave it running for a while and it will not refresh the branch status display. However, if I just close and reopen SourceTree, the branch status updates in a second or two after re-open, vs my losing patience at at least a minute if I just wait for it to refresh.

Not sure why commit, app close, app reopen, repo state refresh is orders of magnitude faster than commit, repo state refresh on my end.
fields.summary: UI stalls on refresh of branch state post commit

fields.description:
The arrows and the number of push/pull in SourceTrees only appear when origin/HEAD exists. One of my repos has it, the number of push / pull and the arrows are shown. The other has no origin/HEAD and the infos are missing. As described here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17639383/how-to-add-missing-origin-head-in-git-repo
the origin/HEAD is not always available.
fields.summary: Arrows and number of push/pull only with existing origin/HEAD

fields.description: Would it be possible for SourceTree to log in to my GitHub and Bitbucket account and retrieve a list of repositories? I realise this is the height of laziness but it'd be nice to have one-click cloning.
fields.summary: Bitbucket & GitHub integration

fields.description:
Allow simplified workflow when using the stage, commit, stage, commit, ... stage, commit paradigm.

A big part of git's draw is the hunk-staging feature, which naturally tends to lead to much more incremental commits of work. SourceTree delivers excellently on this, but that makes the last remaining hitch kind of glaring: if you cherry pick one hunk out of 100, when you click "Commit" the window shuts down and you have to wait while the outer UI refreshes before you can start the process over.

I'd like to stay in the commit ui after each hunk/line is committed until I'm done - either running out of uncomitted changes or closing the commit window myself.
fields.summary: Commit and Continue

fields.description:
During the commit process, if you select "Stage File" in the diff viewer, this causes the "Working Copy Changes" view to reset it's selection to the top file. In the cases of cherry picking changes from a large change set, this is extremely annoying.

REPLICATION:

Use the attached script to create a git repository with a pending change set.

1. Execute the script in the Git Bash window to create a "commit-stage-problem" repository with a change set,
2. Open the repository with SourceTree,
3. Select "Commit",
4. Using "stage file" commit only the files which added cstdint
5. --> Every time you select "stage file" the working copy file selection resets to the top of the list again.
fields.summary: "Stage file" resets the selected file to top of "Working Copy Changes" list

fields.description:
Check the screenshot.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Select a branch or something else in the sidebar
2. It should be highlighted
3. Right click it
4. Menu appears and the highlight disappears, making it confusing which item the menu is about
fields.summary: Tree item highlight in the sidebar disappears on right click

fields.description: I have several branches in my repository and they have different submodules. The submodules are all added and managed by SourceTree. When I switch branches the submodule directories are not deleted and there are lot of leftovers and I have to clean the directory tree manually each time I switch a branch. Please add some configuration so SourceTree will pass some option to git to force cleaning of everything when there are no uncommitted changes in the submodules. I found related discussion here explaining about this problem and how to solve it http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9314365/git-clean-is-not-removing-a-submodule-added-to-a-branch-when-switching-branches . Thanks.
fields.summary: Option to force deletion of submodules when switching branches

fields.description:
Working with many repositories could be useful having a search bar on the SourceTree's repositories list (bookmarks).
Searching by repository's folder name and/or sorting functions could help to find a repository on a large list.
fields.summary: Search in repository list

fields.description: With the Windows 7 Classic Theme, the list of filenames depends on using the Windows background color.The filename text is always showing in white, so when the the window color is also in white the text is not visible.
fields.summary: Windows 7 Classic Theme Shows Filenames in White

fields.description:

fields.summary: crash in System.Windows.Media.VisualCollection.get_Item

fields.description:
Someone made a branch off of a "staging" branch, did a commit, and then I merged that branch back into staging. The other person's computer is off by a day apparently, and his commit shows up as later than the commit I made where I merged it in. The graph show this in a weird way, and for the longest time I thought something went wrong with the merge. There has to be a better way to display the graph in this case.

I've attached two images, one with the weird graph when ordered by date, and the other with the graph ordered by ancestor (which looks good).

notice in the weird case the purple line doesn't connect with the top commit.
fields.summary: Branch diagram looks weird when ordered by date, and someones computer is incorrect.

fields.description:
If I want to discard several changes, I have to perform two separate steps:

1. Highlight only tracked files and choose "Discard"
2. Highlight untracked files and choose "Remove"

I think untracked files should allow "Discard" which would delete the file from disk. This way, I could highlight all files and "Discard" to clean up my working copy.

The user already expects that "Discard" is a destructive operation, so the fact that the file is untracked shouldn't prevent SourceTree from deleting it.
fields.summary: Untracked files should allow "discard" to delete

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Disable "Always show full console output"
2. Click "Start new Hotfix" in a git-flow enabled repository.
3. Enter "test test" as the branch name.
4. Click OK

Expected result: An error explaining that branch names cannot contain spaces.
Actual result: The command appears to succeed but no branch is created.

I suggest fixing this in one of two ways:

1. Show an error explaining that branch names cannot contain spaces
2. Automatically convert spaces to dashes or underscores in entered branch names
fields.summary: git-flow silently fails when branch name contains a space

fields.description:
After upgrading to 1.0.4 (also 1.0.5 and 1.0.6), Hg Flow has stopped working. It worked fine before, but now it always thinks I'm in a feature and only shows the "Finish Feature" and "Other Action..." buttons. If I try to perform any action, I get the error: "Flow has not been initialized for this repository."

If I uninstall SourceTree and re-install version 1.0.3 everything works again.
fields.summary: Hg flow doesn't function properly

fields.description:
I changed the source URL of a subrepo and SourceTree crashed.

fields.summary: Crash when updating subrepo source

fields.description: See attached log files
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on startup

fields.description:
Would it be possible to have an option which clears out any tags which have been removed from the remote server which are still present on the local machine?

Also if this is not possible is there some way to run scripts on a local machine upon events such as fetch, as this would allow this behaviour to be added as wanted as well.
fields.summary: Pull with tags & purge deleted tags

fields.description:
While resolving conflicts in files with spaces in their name.
In [Log / History] right click on the file that contains spaces in the name and selecting [Resolve Conflicts]/[Launch External Merge Tool]
The merge tool will not have received the paths to the files correctly. 

See attached video. Note that this is true for a Mercurial repo only. It seems to work fine with a GIT repo.

External Merge Tool used is BeyondCompare
fields.summary: Resolving Conflicts with External Merge Tool

fields.description:
1. There is no visual feedback indicating, when repo clones are being scanned for new modifications.

2. There seems to be no button or menu item, that can be used to force/trigger scanning a repo clone for modifications.

This leaves me always wondering, whether latest changes are being picked up and whether I can or ought to do something about it, which tends to distract me from my real work objectives.

Apart from that, using source-tree has been a very pleasant journey so far.
fields.summary: you never know, if and when the repo dir is being scanned for changes

fields.description: If some other user deletes remote branch, it's still appears in the remote branches list. But if I try to delete one, I get a message saying that the branch does not exist.
fields.summary: Deleted branches from remote repository still being showed in SourceTree

fields.description:
Hi,

When I am back down the log looking at some older commit, it seems that when the timer to "check the default remotes for updates" kicks in, I get thrown back up to the top of the log, losing my position.

This is pretty annoying when in the middle of a problem and I have to spend time getting back to where I was.

Thanks

James.
fields.summary: When I am back in the history in the full log view looking at some past commit, after a certain period of time i get wound forward to the latest commits

fields.description:
Whenever the list of working copy changes is refreshed, the sort column(s) and order are reset.

For example, I prefer my working copy change list to be sorted by path, then by file name (which is probably the most common and helpful sort order).  However, every time a file changes and the view is auto-refreshed, or if I refresh it manually, the list goes back to being sorted in a non-intuitive order (by file name only?)

The desired behavior would be for sort column(s) and sort order to be saved across refreshes of the list, across sessions, and would be saved per project.
fields.summary: Working copy file list sorting is reset when refreshed

fields.description: On the commit dialog, add a way to easily select or unselect all file names. Currently one has to select each one individually.
fields.summary: Select/Unselect All on Commit Dialog

fields.description:
(sorry about the title, I'm not sure how to formulate this one)

Introduction:

I have a project which is actually several projects related by a common domain-specific file format. 
Each project have it's own git repository and there is a repository that gather them all if you need to get all projects together.
See: https://github.com/artofsequence
See the image to see visually how subrepos organized.

Now, as I'm founder of the projects, I work on all of them. When I work on aos-designer, aosl-cpp or utilcpp, I tend to use directly a clone of aos-all, so that I can commit changes in these different repos in sync (they can be used separately too so I still need them in different repositories) - you can see the subrepos on the screenshot.

However, when I work on aos-webplayer or aosl, I tend to use several separate clone repos on my local disk because I do a lot of experimentation. (on the screenshot, some of these repos are visible on the left)

The Problem:

Let's say I have a repo open in SourceTree and I open subrepos. Then I open repositories that are forks of the master repos of these subrepos.
As you can see on the screenshot, there is no way to differentiate between subrepo or not subrepo clones by looking at the tabs titles.
Even when you open the window, you might have no clue about if it is or not a subrepo.

Basically my request is to have some signal to:

 - help identify which open repository is a subrepo clone or not;
 - if it's a subrepo clone, help identify which repo is the parent (it should be in the upper directory hierarchy anyway, otherwise it's a separate clone);

Some ideas:

 - just have a tooltip displaying the full address of the repository when you move the mouse over the tab name (I think it's the simplest way to fix it and it also help locate where it is);
 - maybe have different tab colors for open subrepos?
fields.summary: SubRepos names in tabs are the same than normal repo names

fields.description:
When the commit window is displayed, there is no visual way to check which branch I'm into (and avoid surprised after committing...).

In doubt I cancel, go back, check and commit again, so it's not an important feature, but I think it might be an easy usability improvement to just display the branch name somewhere in the commit window.
fields.summary: Display the branch name when committing

fields.description: I have java diff tool . JMeld. It is in "C:\Program Files\JMeld-2.1.jar", so I configure external tool javaw and pass arguments -jar "C:\Program Files\JMeld-2.1.jar" "$LOCAL" "$REMOTE", but it seems the quotes are not respected and java receives c:program
fields.summary: Unable to start external viewer with argument containing spaces

fields.description: After I select all pending files with Ctrl + A, the selection won't go away no matter where I click, unless I change the filter.
fields.summary: Unable to deselect files in "File status" view

fields.description:
abort: could not find web.cacerts: cacert.pem

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Mercurial Pushing is broken because of missing cacert.pem

fields.description:
Keep getting this message.

########################
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false add -f -- "notes/Code/Agents/FoCul_5cSet selected rating to Excellent.fa"
fatal: Unable to create 'C:/Program Files (x86)/IBM/Notes/Data/workspace/GIT/git-xxxxxx-merit-awards/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git

process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
########################

Rebooted, deleted lock file, started ST, staged some files and then got this when trying to stage further files.
fields.summary: git lock issue

fields.description:
Git Flow has the ability to automatically delete the remote branch (along with the local branch) of a feature/hotfix/etc after finishing using the -F option. The -F option fetches the remote branch before it deletes it remotely so you don't lose any work.
      git flow feature finish -F branch_name

It would be nice to have the same function available from within SourceTree.

See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/171850/sourcetree-and-git-flow-remote-branch-delete-on-finish
fields.summary: Git Flow - delete remote branch on finish feature

fields.description:
Unsure as to how to reproduce this situation as of yet, however it seems that sometimes sourcetree ends up checking out a branch and then not setting the remote branch to track.

We noticed this after people were not rebasing changes and were instead doing merges which was caused by Sourcetree not checking the rebase option when doing a pull even though it was set as the default action in the tools -> options -> git panel
fields.summary: Remotes not tracked

fields.description:
Just wondering why, but when cloning git repos in sourcetree from Stash it seems that origin/head seems to exist in the display, however this branch does not actually exist on the remote and when going to delete it from the remotes it errors, but if you refresh or do a fetch after that then the branch will vanish from sourcetree.

Originally I thought this was just due to cloning from Stash via http and was something related to that, however now it seems to have been there until I deleted it in my ssh related repo instead.
fields.summary: When cloning a git repo remote branch shows up origin/head

fields.description: Application crush when exists especial chars like "á" in the filename
fields.summary: Crash on special chars

fields.description:
Currently when a commit has been tagged, the information that is shown for the log does not include the input from the tag itself, so if a message is added to a tag unless someone right clicks the tag and uses details it is not ever seen.

This would just make it easier to view the information about a tag etc.
fields.summary: Display of tag information on a commit where it is made

fields.description:
In hg repository, clicked Pull. preview Pane displayed and loaded revisions correctly. clicked OK and crash occurred. log file attached

largefiles extension is activated.

Have since repeated the process successfully.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed during pull over VPN

fields.description:
The commit message text area doesn't soft-wrap, so when typing a long commit message the input horizontally scrolls.

SourceTree on Mac soft-wraps correctly.
fields.summary: Commit message text area doesn't soft-wrap

fields.description:
I have a local repository with a few uncommited changes, 1 changeset outgoing, 0 incoming towards mainstream (hg incoming and hg outgoing confirm that).
The "1" number is on the push icon, and in the repository list -> ok
But when I click on push, I get a dialog with "no changes to push".

Some other repositories in the same configuration don't have this problem.
fields.summary: Push dialog is empty

fields.description:
I didn't try with git repos. I have several repositories with default source being hosted on code.google.com like for example:

 - https://code.google.com/p/ogre-procedural/
 - https://code.google.com/p/radiant-laser-cross/

I observed that:

 1. if I already have a clone but not up to date when I compare changes with wha'ts displayed on the Google Code related page, Sourcetree don't detect that it's not up to date and will never provide a way to pull. It says that there is no changes to pull. I didn't try with push. 
 2. if I try to clone of these repositories, in the dialog checking the repository kind when I paste the address (copied from the project's "checkout" page) then I get an error where it failed to access the repository. If I try to do the same using TortoiseHG I got no problem.

Again note that I didn't try to explore further (push, git) because of lack of time, but basically there is something wrong with getting data from these repositories.
fields.summary: Can't pull/clone from code.google.com

fields.description:
As recently implemented on Mac, the ability to see the a list of historical commands issued on a repository with their full output. 

Output should persist only for the life of the app and should top out at a user-configurable number.
fields.summary: Command log

fields.description: Click on parents revision number not work in Hg but work in Git repo
fields.summary: Click on parents revision in Hg log window not working

fields.description:
Would it be possible to change the default settings for the Push feature so that only the current branch is selected?

Generally I just want to push the changes I have made on my current branch, I'd of thought that would be the most common use case.

Currently all branches are selected by default but I don't usually want to push all changes across the whole repository at once.

Thanks, Mike
fields.summary: Default settings for Push

fields.description: Right clicking on a commit, on a working copy, and choosing "Tag.." Enter the tag name leaving all other options as they are defaulted, causes SourceTree to crash, and does not add the Tag. Log file is attached.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when trying to add a tag to a previous commit

fields.description:
Like in hipchat you recieve a notification when something happens in a chat room. It would be great to recieve a notification when new changes in a repository occur (new branch, commits etc). This makes it very easy
to stay on top of changes (if you are doing a lot merging)
fields.summary: Notification for incomming changes

fields.description:
Right now it's difficult to determine the current branch you
are working on. In tortoise hg workbench the current branch/commit
is highlighted in bold.
fields.summary: Show current branch
I am unable to re-order the tabs for different repositories in the interface.

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to see more of an emphasis on the active branch in the left side tree.

At the moment the only thing that denotes it is active is a tiny tick icon which is very hard to discern on a high res monitor.

Thanks

James
fields.summary: Make the active branch more noticeable in the branch list

fields.description:
Thanks for provided us the good git client software.
I using it as primary git tools. but we faced a big problem, after the proccess finished, such as commit, or pull , push. 
the child window not automatic closed for me. we should only click the close button.
why not let it auto closed for me ? after 3 seconds display, the child windows could be closed automatic by it's self.
or when error occured, the windows should always display , not auto closed.

i have another idea, when we press ESC key, the child windows can be easily closed.
fields.summary: After finish proccess, the child windows should be quickly closed.

fields.description: When I switch between repository branches, the files are not checked out and the active branch remains there although the UI says that it has changed. This was working before, but know I have to use TortoiseGit to switch between branches
fields.summary: Switching between branches does not actually checkout the branch

fields.description: Is there a way to change the commit message in SourceTree? If not can you please add this feature? Thanks!
fields.summary: Change commit message

fields.description:
It looks like freeze problem fixed.

But I've attached screenshot, with throbber that shows for the same long time, as freezes were before you fixed them.

I can't see comments and changes for any repository and commit until it disappears.
fields.summary: Long throbber after fetch in background

fields.description:
A few people complain that SourceTree refreshes constantly - this is actually not our fault but another app constantly writing data into the repo and triggering a refresh via the file events. We usually advise them to disable the auto-refresh for this repo or generally.

Perhaps we should try to detect this file event flood and suggest disabling the auto-refresh. The trouble is there can be good reasons for the flood to happen temporarily such as running builds, so we don't want to identify those incorrectly. The difference is usually that when you're building SourceTree is in the background so isn't actually refreshing but is receiving the file events to perform a refresh when you next switch back.

Maybe we should only detect this flood of refreshes when the app has the focus and especially when they're trying to commit? We don't have the same 'flood' protection we do on the Mac version so that might be a first step, although it doesn't stop the problem happening on Mac sometimes too (e.q. tools like Qt Designer).
fields.summary: Detect constant stream of file events & suggest disabling auto-refresh?

fields.description: Overriding the tag name that would be created is good or some way to set the prefix that gets attached.
fields.summary: When creating a tag when for example finishing a hotfix, it would be good to be able to rename the tags due to using branch name

fields.description: If there is a branch which has been removed on the remote, however it has not been fully merged in then sourcetree will not remove it, however there is also no message to signify this, perhaps one could be displayed or some sort of notifications area to display the message to be looked at etc?
fields.summary: When doing a fetch, with the prune branches no longer on remote option checked, show message about unmerged branch?

fields.description:
If mercurial Support is not enabled, and you are trying to add a mercurial repo to SourceTree, then is says: "This is not a valid source path".

The root cause was actually because Mercurial support was not enabled.

It would be a good suggestion to show a message "Mercurial support not enabled" instead of invalid URL.
fields.summary: Warning of "Mercurial support not enabled"

fields.description:
The pull button for Hg calls "hg incoming --bundle" (I assume) for previewing incoming changes before pulling.

When using hg with svn repos, --bundle is not supported (by hgsubversion), this causes the pull command to never pull anything.

Some kind of alternative should be implemented to support pull from hgsubversion repos. 

Maybe a "bypass incoming" or "force pull", etc...
fields.summary: Hg pull with hgsubversion

fields.description: I installed the embedded version of mercurial. When I clicked ok in the options window, SourceTree crashed.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashed after installing embedded mercurial support

fields.description: I have a branch that is tracking a remote branch. When I right click the branch and go to track remote branch, it is listed as tracking (None). Also, when I right click, the menu shows "Pull  (tracked)" and "Push to  (tracked)". When the local branch and remote differ, things work fine, but when they are the same, it looks as if my local branch isn't tracking anything.
fields.summary: Tracked branches don't show as tracked when there are no differences

fields.description:
When selecting the following items from the help menu, the whole application crashes instantly:

Release Notes...
FAQ
Ask a Question...
Raise a support ticket...
Request a New Feature

Also, I would like to mention the last entry should probably be named: "Report a bug / Request a New Feature"
fields.summary: Crash when selecting items from the 'Help' menu

fields.description: log file attached
fields.summary: Crash after pulling a large amount of commits

fields.description: For the context menu and in general where the phrase "current branch" is written, it would be good if either that were replaced with the actual current branch or perhaps it were added next to it in brackets as a nice to have.
fields.summary: Replace phrase "current branch" with branch name or similar

fields.description: Add support for "Repo" in order to ease Android development workflow
fields.summary: As an Android developer, I would like to be able to use Repo from Stash in order to syncronize all of my project's Android dependencies

fields.description: I frequently use Drag'n'Drop to quickly open file, selected in WinCVS, in MS Visual Studio. It would be nice to have similar feature in SourceTree - dragging files from "Working Copy Changes" window into Visual Studio to be open.
fields.summary: Drag'n'Drop files from 'Working copy changes' window

fields.description:
I use "polish (programmer)" keyboard layout in Windows. While typing commit message I can't use some polish diacritical letters: ć ł ó
To type these letter, we use [Right Alt] or [Ctrl] + [Left Alt], but these combinations are already used by SourceTree for some functions like "Commit Selected" (ctrl+alt+c).

These letters are working in "Options" modal window.

Best option is to change shortcuts to [Ctrl]+[Key] or [Ctrl]+[Shift]+[Key].
"Keyboard shortcuts editor" could be also helpful.
fields.summary: Key shortcuts colliding with polish keyboard layout

fields.description: The Git merge command has e.g. whitespace handling options. Git does change often line endings when using auto-crlf. Without this option a lot of pseudo-conflicts occurs which leads to annoying manual merging. It would be very nice when Sourcetree would support this option in its GUI for merges...
fields.summary: Make SourceTree support Merge options
